pullrequest.title: Highlight visuals on align independently of how nested they are, with test

content.raw:
I didn't originally write these formulas, and when I saw them for the first time I was also intrigued. 

Back on commit 836981d I added the `abs` part to make it work nicely back and forth and created [a spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/a/osrfoundation.org/spreadsheets/d/1MCbxv7eI8C_qC15AN7tYY8D0iMhdfwaFhuTeuJ_BJlo/edit?usp=sharing) to see how the numbers are changing. Not sure how to explain it, it's "mathemagic" :) It's pretty neat, a nice way to change a value in the [0, 1] range to another value and then go back without needing to store the original value. I remember trying find this specific equation somewhere else but I couldn't...

By the way, back on commit e116994 I added the logic to change the transparency of the top-level children which was too limited and is being extended here.
